definitions.definition: The superior or head of an abbey or monastery .
examples: The newly appointed abbot decided to take a tour of the abbey with the cardinal's emissary.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested around the early 12 century.

definitions.definition: The pastor or administrator of an order , including minor and major orders starting with the minor order of porter.
A layman who received the abbey's revenues, after the closing of the monasteries.
A ponce ; a man employed by a prostitute to find clients , and who may also act as a bodyguard or equivalent to a bouncer .

main_definition: The superior or head of an abbey or monastery . [First attested around the early 12 century.]
secondary_definitions: The pastor or administrator of an order , including minor and major orders starting with the minor order of porter.
A layman who received the abbey's revenues, after the closing of the monasteries.
( archaic , British slang ) A brothel-owner's husband or lover .
( archaic , British slang ) A ponce ; a man employed by a prostitute to find clients , and who may also act as a bodyguard or equivalent to a bouncer .
